description: Manages the receipt, validation, and payment of all third-party invoices. Ensures payments are only made for valid, authorized goods and services, mitigating financial and operational risks.

activities.name: Invoice Intake
activities.description: Invoices are received via corporate email or supplier portal. System logs a new entry and assigns a unique tracking number.

activities.name: Initial Validation
activities.description: Analyst verifies invoice completeness and legibility (vendor name, invoice number, date, total amount).

activities.name: Three-Way Match
activities.description: System cross-references invoice against PO and GRN. Discrepancies trigger a hold and manual review by AP Supervisor.

activities.name: Threshold-Based Approval
activities.description: Invoice routing based on amount: <$5,000 to department manager; $5,000-$25,000 to senior manager; >$25,000 to Director of Finance.

activities.name: Duplicate Check
activities.description: System checks invoice ID, vendor details, and amount against historical payments to identify duplicate payments.

activities.name: Payment Processing
activities.description: Approved invoice is released to AP system for payment. Notification sent to vendor.

risks.name: Incomplete or Illegible Invoices
risks.description: Invoices received may be incomplete, illegible, or missing crucial information, leading to delays in processing and potential payment errors.

risks.name: Invoice Processing Errors
risks.description: Human error during manual verification and approval stages can lead to incorrect invoice processing, resulting in delayed payments or incorrect payments.

risks.name: System Failure
risks.description: Failure of the invoice processing system can disrupt the entire process, leading to significant delays and potential financial losses.

risks.name: Fraudulent Invoices
risks.description: Malicious actors may submit fraudulent invoices to obtain unauthorized payments.

risks.name: Duplicate Payments
risks.description: System failures or human error can lead to duplicate payments to vendors.

risks.name: Non-Compliance with Payment Terms
risks.description: Failure to adhere to internal policies or regulatory requirements regarding invoice processing and payment can result in penalties or legal issues.

controls.name: Invoice Data Validation Rules
controls.description: System rules to check for completeness and accuracy of invoice data during input (step 1) and validation (step 2).

controls.name: Three-Way Matching Process
controls.description: Automated system check (step 3) comparing invoice, purchase order, and goods receipt note to identify discrepancies.

controls.name: Multi-Level Approval Workflow
controls.description: Threshold-based approval routing (step 4) ensures appropriate authorization based on invoice amount.

controls.name: Duplicate Invoice Detection System
controls.description: System check (step 5) compares invoice details against historical payments to identify duplicates.

controls.name: Regular System Backups and Disaster Recovery Plan
controls.description: Regular backups and a disaster recovery plan to minimize the impact of system failures.

controls.name: Audit Trail and Monitoring
controls.description: Maintaining a detailed audit trail of all invoice processing activities for monitoring and review.

controls.name: Segregation of Duties
controls.description: Different individuals handle invoice receipt, validation, approval, and payment to prevent fraud and errors.
